answers.answer: Hi there. For tingling in right thigh, rule out diabetes, hypothyroidism, alcohol intake,  vitamin B12 deficiency, compressive radiculopathy.  Your neurologist should do a detailed examination of these possible causes and treat like wise.MRI  would increase their  chances of diagnosis.Take care.

question: I was feeling a tingling sensation at the top of my right thigh area, more recently I felt a sharp pain towards the inner area of my thigh region towards my crotch. when I walk around the tingling and sharp pain subsides, however when I get out of bed, or when I sit long periods of time, the tingling and sharp pain re-emerges at the top of my right thigh area. What could be causing this problem?
title: Right Thigh Tingling Sensation
